errors.message:
Syntax error at line buildSrc/gradlew:72:
 `APP_HOME=${app_path%"${app_path##*/}"}  # leaves a trailing /; empty if no leading path
` was unexpected

Syntax error at line gradlew:74:
 `APP_HOME=${app_path%"${app_path##*/}"}  # leaves a trailing /; empty if no leading path
` was unexpected

extra.message: If an attacker can supply values that the application then uses to determine which class to instantiate or which method to invoke, the potential exists for the attacker to create control flow paths through the application that were not intended by the application developers. This attack vector may allow the attacker to bypass authentication or access control checks or otherwise cause the application to behave in an unexpected manner.

cwe: CWE-470: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection')

extra.message: DOCTYPE declarations are enabled for this DocumentBuilderFactory. This is vulnerable to XML external entity attacks. Disable this by setting the feature "http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" to true. Alternatively, allow DOCTYPE declarations and only prohibit external entities declarations. This can be done by setting the features "http://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" and "http://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" to false.

cwe: CWE-611: Improper Restriction of XML External Entity Reference

extra.message: Detected use of a Java socket that is not encrypted. As a result, the traffic could be read by an attacker intercepting the network traffic. Use an SSLSocket created by 'SSLSocketFactory' or 'SSLServerSocketFactory' instead.

Detected non-static command inside `...`. If unverified user data can reach this call site, this is a code injection vulnerability. A malicious actor can inject a malicious script to execute arbitrary code.

cwe: CWE-94: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')

extra.message: bcrypt hash detected

Detected a method annotated with 'RequestMapping' that does not specify the HTTP method. CSRF protections are not enabled for GET, HEAD, TRACE, or OPTIONS, and by default all HTTP methods are allowed when the HTTP method is not explicitly specified. This means that a method that performs state changes could be vulnerable to CSRF attacks. To mitigate, add the 'method' field and specify the HTTP method (such as 'RequestMethod.POST').

Detected a method annotated with 'RequestMapping' that does not specify the HTTP method. CSRF protections are not enabled for GET, HEAD, TRACE, or OPTIONS, and by default all HTTP methods are allowed when the HTTP method is not explicitly specified. This means that a method that performs state changes could be vulnerable to CSRF attacks. To mitigate, add the 'method' field and specify the HTTP method (such as 'RequestMethod.POST').
An object-returning LDAP search will allow attackers to control the LDAP response. This could lead to Remote Code Execution.

asvs.section: V5: Validation, Sanitization and Encoding Verification Requirements

cwe: CWE-90: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an LDAP Query ('LDAP Injection')

extra.message: URL rewriting has significant security risks. Since session ID appears in the URL, it may be easily seen by third parties.

cwe: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

extra.message: A cookie was detected without setting the 'HttpOnly' flag. The 'HttpOnly' flag for cookies instructs the browser to forbid client-side scripts from reading the cookie. Set the 'HttpOnly' flag by calling 'cookie.setHttpOnly(true);'

A cookie was detected without setting the 'secure' flag. The 'secure' flag for cookies prevents the client from transmitting the cookie over insecure channels such as HTTP. Set the 'secure' flag by calling 'f.apply(request).setSecure(true);'

cwe: CWE-614: Sensitive Cookie in HTTPS Session Without 'Secure' Attribute

extra.message: Detected SHA1 hash algorithm which is considered insecure. SHA1 is not collision resistant and is therefore not suitable as a cryptographic signature. Instead, use PBKDF2 for password hashing or SHA256 or SHA512 for other hash function applications.

Detected SHA1 hash algorithm which is considered insecure. SHA1 is not collision resistant and is therefore not suitable as a cryptographic signature. Instead, use PBKDF2 for password hashing or SHA256 or SHA512 for other hash function applications.

DOCTYPE declarations are enabled for this DocumentBuilderFactory. This is vulnerable to XML external entity attacks. Disable this by setting the feature "http://apache.org/xml/features/disallow-doctype-decl" to true. Alternatively, allow DOCTYPE declarations and only prohibit external entities declarations. This can be done by setting the features "http://xml.org/sax/features/external-general-entities" and "http://xml.org/sax/features/external-parameter-entities" to false.
